definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: He was snapped making sure the windows were sparkling by a resident in a neighbouring apartment block.
sentences.chinese: 他烦恼一定是邻近公寓楼的住户让窗玻璃发出闪光。

sentences.english: And on the playground behind the building, only the wind plays on the swing.
sentences.chinese: 在公寓楼后边的游戏场上，玩秋千的只有一阵阵的风。

sentences.english: The building provides some amenities including a fitness center and a shopping mall.
sentences.chinese: 公寓楼提供很多便民设施，包括健身中心和商场。

sentences.english: See your brain’s thoughts as one massive Apartment Block.
sentences.chinese: 把你脑中的想法看做一座大型的公寓楼。

sentences.english: At 2 A. M. the neighbors called the police to quell the bacchanalian revelry in the upstairs apartment.
sentences.chinese: 凌晨两点，邻居们叫警察来制止公寓楼上的饮酒狂欢。

sentences.english: At first, Leonard had liked staying at her apartment building.
sentences.chinese: 起初，伦纳德挺喜欢住在她的公寓楼里。

sentences.english: See your brain's thoughts as one massive Apartment Block.
sentences.chinese: 把大脑中的想法看作是一幢巨大的公寓楼。

sentences.english: There's that new apartment building on Bedford Street. Bedford Manor.
sentences.chinese: 在贝德街有幢新公寓楼，贝德福德庄园。

sentences.english: You'll be surprised how flats are being lapped up.
sentences.chinese: 你可能很惊奇，公寓楼怎能如此之畅销。

sentences.english: The technology-talent apartment complex is under construction.
sentences.chinese: 正在建设科技人才公寓楼。

sentences.english: Chen Fengyi, whose 5-year-old son was snatched from outside her apartment building in Huizhou, said she called the police the moment she realized he was missing.
sentences.chinese: 陈凤仪5岁大的儿子在她惠州的公寓楼外面被拐走了。

sentences.english: Men and women go in and out flat building on Huaihai Road.
sentences.chinese: 上海出入于淮海路公寓楼里的男女。

sentences.english: Come up the slope to reach a six-story apartment house.
sentences.chinese: 上一个坡，走到一个六层的公寓楼。

sentences.english: Nidal Malik Hasan went to his next-door neighbor at the rundown apartment complex where he rented a one-bedroom unit and gave her most of his belongings, saying he would not need them any more.
sentences.chinese: 他在这座破旧的公寓楼里租有一个一居室的单元房。

sentences.english: A few months later, a six-story apartment building collapsed in Wuhan, Hubei province.
sentences.chinese: 数月以后，湖北省武汉市的一栋六层公寓楼倒塌。

sentences.english: He also described damage to a grocery store and a large apartment building.
sentences.chinese: 他还描述了一个杂货店和一个大公寓楼被破坏的情况。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
